data.title: [Solved] Which one is not correct about Leopold Von Ranke?
data.meta_description:

	Leopold Von Ranke (1795-1886) was a German historian wh
data.text:
The option that is not correct about Leopold Von Ranke is he was the father of Romanticism.Key Points

Leopold Von Ranke (1795-1886) was a German historian who is widely regarded as one of the founding fathers of modern historical scholarship.

Ranke played a significant role in establishing history as a respected academic discipline in the universities.

Ranke emphasized the importance of primary sources in historical research and argued that historians should rely on rigorous methodology in their work.

He believed that the role of the historian was to simply report the facts of the past, rather than impose their own subjective interpretations or judgments.

This approach is sometimes referred to as the "historical method" and it has been highly influential in the development of modern historiography.

While Ranke was an important figure in 19th-century German intellectual life, he is not associated with Romanticism.

In fact, his approach to historical scholarship was often seen as a reaction against the Romantic emphasis on subjective experience and imagination.

Ranke's ideas were more closely aligned with the emerging scientific method and the Enlightenment's emphasis on reason and empirical evidence.

So we can conclude that the option that is not correct about Leopold Von Ranke is he was the father of Romanticism.

-> The exam comprises two papers - Paper I and Paper II. Paper I consists of 50 questions and Paper II consists of 100 questions.
